post.description:
Shape files API and property search API.  All requests return the parcel boundaries in GEOJSON format.  Quickly implement this API into your mapping applications.  

Questions on how to best implement this API into your map?  Just reach out to our team for best practices with using this API.

parameters.name: x-user-id
parameters.description: Denote a unique user identifier to this api call by passing it in this header field

id.description: A property ID from any Property Search API result record. If this ID is provided, no other fields are required

address.description: A fully formatted address with the following format: 123 Main St, Arlington VA 22205. When this field is provided and is in the valid format, no other fields are required

house.description: House number field is to be used with the street, city, state, and zip fields (& unit if applicable)

state.description: The state code for the desired state (e.g. Virginia = VA)

post.description: Comps, Mortgages, Mailing Addresses, Property Sales History & More!

parameters.name: x-user-id
parameters.description: Denote a unique user identifier to this api call by passing it in this header field

id.description: The "id" property from the Property Search API result objects. If using this unique property ID for Property Detail, then no other fields are required.

comps.description: Set to true if you would like to have houses nearby with conferable valuations returned as part of the response. ***Includes RealEstateAPI's special AVM for the property***

exact_match.description: only return matches that match your exact address or address parts, no fuzzy matching

address.description: A fully formatted address with the following format: 123 Main St, Arlington VA 22205. When this field is provided and is in the valid format, no other fields are required

house.description: House number field is to be used with the street, city, state, and zip fields (& unit if applicable)

unit.description: House unit number (for Apt. #'s, Suite #'s, etc.)

street.description: The street name of the property (e.g. Main St)

city.description: The city where the property is located

state.description: The 2 character state code for the property's state (e.g. VA = Virginia)

county.description: (*This field is not required for a fully formatted address*) The county where your search property is located.

apn.description: The assessor's parcel number (APN) is a unique identifier for an address/parcel & is particularly helpful when looking up Land Parcels without House Numbers

post.description: For retrieving of up to 1000 properties at once.  Can be used standalone, but it's designed to work together with the Property Search API.  Use this API for quickly exporting lists, or bulk search requests for analytics.  Pass in addresses, or a list of ID's returned from the Property Search API.

parameters.name: x-user-id
parameters.description: Denote a unique user identifier to this api call by passing it in this header field

ids.description: List of property ids returned in the response of our Property Search API

post.description: Searchable API for list building, search counts, and advanced filtering on properties.  You can also use this API to implement your own comparables API, or property analytics API.  Questions?  Contact our team to ask us for best practices with using this API.This API implements easy paging so your apps can easily manage filtered results in a results pane with paging.  When your user clicks on a result, just use the id from this API to get the full property results using the Property Detail API.  Questions on best practices for implementing paged property results in your app?  Just contact our team.

parameters.name: x-user-id
parameters.description: Denote a unique user identifier to this api call by passing it in this header field

count.description: Set to true to only return the count for the total  number of records that would be returned for the search and not the records themselves.

ids.description: Provide a list of property IDs from past or saved Property Searches to pull back all of the enriched fields

ids_only.description: Returns up to 10,000 property IDs matching your search criteria. When provided, the "size" and "resultIndex" will be ignored.

obfuscate.description: Will remove the address and name fields on the properties returned

sort.description: Sorts result set based on user defined sorting definitions across the Property Search fields

summary.description: Returns an aggregation of all lead types in a summary object. The summary object will return totals for each lead type within the context of the given search.

resultIndex.description: Used with size to accomplish paging.  The server will skip the number of records specified by resultIndex, and return the records starting after the resultIndex.  The total number of records returned will not be greater than the size specified, or a max of 250 set by the server.

size.description: Set to the maximum number of records that the server can return for the search.  Used in conjunction with resultIndex for paging results.

address.description: Fully formatted address for a property search.  This should include house, street, city, state and zip

house.description: Used to search for specific house numbers.   Must be accompanied with state or zip to limit results.

street.description: Used to search searching street names only.  Must be accompanied with state or zip to limit results.

city.description: Used to search within a city only.  Must be accompanied with state or zip to limit results.

state.description: Used to search within a state.  Must be accompanied by city, house, or street to limit results.

county.description: Used to search within a county.  Must be accompanied by state, or zip.

zip.description: Used to search within a US zip code. An array of zips (of type:string) can also be provided to this field.

latitude.description: If latitude & longitude are provided, the search radius will be calculated with that set of coordinates as center

longitude.description: If latitude & longitude are provided, the search radius will be calculated with that set of coordinates as center

radius.description: Provide a search radius between 0.1-10 miles for narrowing your search

polygon.description: Provide an array of latitude/longitude pairs for the Geo portion of your query

property_type.description: Provide the type of residences/properties you are looking for

property_use_code.description: Also accepts an Array of Integers, where each integer is one of our accepted Property Use Codes. See all codes here: https://developer.realestateapi.com/reference/property-use-codes-reference

mls_pending.description: Find pending MLS sales that are expected to close

mls_days_on_market_min.description: Find properties that have been on the market for a certain amount of days. Use with "mls_active": true, "mls_pending": true or "mls_cancelled": true

mls_listing_price_min.description: Lower bound used with mls_listing_max to only find properties with MLS listing prices within a defined range

mls_listing_price.description: The official MLS listing price for the property

mls_listing_price_operator.description: mls_operator is to be used with mls_listing_price to indicate a range less than or greater than starting with that listing price. For example, { mls_listing_price: 100000, mls_operator: 'gte' } would retrieve all properties with an MLS listing price of $100,000 or more

id.description: AutoComplete Field. Can be a string or an integer. Represents the unique property id in the case of full address autocomplete searches.

apn.description: AutoComplete Field. The Property's unique tax assessor identifier, returned as part of the AutoComplete API response.

searchType.description: AutoComplete Field. A = full address ; C = city ; N = county; S = street ; Z = zip; G = neighborhood; T = state

absentee_owner.description: Used for searching for properties where the owner is not currently a resident.  Generally signifies a tenant or non-owner occupied property.

adjustable_rate.description: Indicates if the current mortgage on the property has an adjustable rate.

assumable.description: Indicates if the mortgage on a given property is assumable.

auction.description: Used to find properties with an auction date.  Used with search_range or a default max of 1 year.

basement.description: Used to find properties with a basement.

carport.description: Indicates properties with a carport structure.

cash_buyer.description: Indicates if the property ownership is subsequent to an all cash transaction

corporate_owned.description: Used to find properties where one of the owners is company.

death.description: Used to find properties where the property owner on the deed is recently deceased. Can be used for probate lists.

deck.description: Used to find properties that have a deck

feature_balcony.description: Used to find properties with a balcony.

fire_sprinklers.description: Used to find properties with registered fire sprinkler fixtures.

flood_zone.description: Indicates if the property is in a flood zone area. This flag can be used in conjunction with "flood_zone_type" to get more specific result sets.

foreclosure.description: Used to find properties in foreclosure.  Used with search_range or a default max of 1 year.

free_clear.description: Used to find properties without an open mortgage.

garage.description: Used to find properties with a physical structure marked for garage use.

inherited.description: Set to true to search inherited properties

in_state_owner.description: Used to find properties with an owner whose mailing address is in the same state as the property address.

investor_buyer.description: Signals that the property was cash purchased by an absentee owner/investor, rather than individual like with the cash_buyer flag

judgment.description: Used to find properties where a lawsuit has been filed against a property owner or a party involved in a real estate transaction, and the court rules in favor of one of the parties, and issued a judgment.

mfh_5plus.description: Multi-family homes with 5 or more units

out_of_state_owner.description: Used to find properties with an owner whose mailing address is in a different state as the property address.

patio.description: Used to find properties with a patio

pool.description: Used to find properties with a pool

pre_foreclosure.description: Used to find poperties that have received any notice of preforeclosure.   Used with search_range or a default max of 1 year.

prior_owner_individual.description: Helps determine what properties are the result of a Flip. Use with "prior_owner_months_owned_min"/"prior_owner_months_owned_max"

private_lender.description: Returns all properties that are currently financed by a private lender

quit_claim.description: Indicates if the property ownership was subsequent to a quit claim

reo.description: Used to find properties owned by a bank, trust, services entity, or tax entity.  Used with search_range or a default max of 1 year.

rv_parking.description: The property is designated as having RV Parking

tax_lien.description: Find properties where there is a tax lien against the property

trust_owned.description: The property is owned by a Trust

vacant.description: Used to find properties that are vacant

census_tract.description: Official tract number from the U.S. Census Bureau

document_type_code.description: Used to find a specific document type for more granular searches other than the booleans provided.  This field can also be assigned an array of document type codes. Used in conjunction with search_range, or a maximum default value of 1 year.

flood_zone_type.description: B, C, X (for moderate to low risk areas); A, AE, A1-30, AH, AO, AR, A99, V, VE, V1 - V30 (High Risk - Coastal Areas); D (Undetermined Risk Zone)

loan_type_code_first.description: Refer to the Loan Codes that are searchable://developer.realestateapi.com/reference/loan-type-codes

notice_type.description: Search by the Recording Date of the .foreclosureInfo data for the specified notice type

search_range.description: Used in conjunction for reo, auction, foreclosure, and preforeclosure searches to limit the search to only return records where the event happened within the provided range.  All ranges work from NOW back to the provided range.

sewage.description: Options: Municipal, Yes, Septic, None, Storm

water_source.description: Full list of water source types you can filter by: https://developer.realestateapi.com/reference/water-source-searches

estimated_equity.description: Used in conjunction with the equity_percent_operator to find properties where the estimated equity amount is greater than or less than the value provided.  Equity dollar amount is computed as the difference of the estimated value less any known open mortgages.

equity_operator.description: Comparison operator for searches using estimated_equity.  Returns properties based on a greater than, or less than operation coupled with the value provided for estimated_equity which is based on total dollars of equity estimated from the estimated value and any known open mortgages.

equity_percent.description: Used in conjunction with the equity_percent_operator to find properties where the equity percentage is greater than or less than the value provided.  Equity percentage is a based on the difference of the computed LTV.

equity_percent_operator.description: Comparison operator for searches using equity_percent.  Returns properties based on a greater than, or less than operation coupled with the value provided for equity_percent which is based on the difference of the calculated LTV.

last_sale_date.description: Find properties based on the date of the last sale history transaction

last_sale_date_operator.description: Used in conjunction with "last_sale_date" to find properties that satisfy the range for when they were last sold in a transaction.

median_income.description: Find properties based on the median income of the Areas that contain the properties

median_income_operator.description: Used in conjunction with the "median_income" field in order to specify the range lower or higher you want to look at from the given median_income.

years_owned.description: Number value of the years owned you are searching for. To be used with years_owned_operator

years_owned_operator.description: Operator for less than and greater than searches on years_owned field

assessed_improvement_value_min.description: Value range search against the county assessed improvement value

assessed_land_value_min.description: Value range search against the county assessed land value

assessed_value_min.description: Value range search against the county assessed value

auction_date_min.description: filter on dates of upcoming foreclosure auctions (e.g. Current Date "2024-05-01" & set a future date range of "2024-05-15" to "2024-05-30"). Use with "auction": true

baths_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties with bathrooms between a min and max.  Minimum numbers of bathrooms for the given property search

baths_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties with bathrooms between a min and max.  Maximum numbers of bathrooms for the given property search

beds_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties with bedrooms between a min and max.  Minimum numbers of bedrooms for the given property search

beds_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties with bedrooms between a min and max.  Maximum numbers of bedrooms for the given property search

building_size_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties with an interior, living square footage between a min and max.  Minimum square footage of the interior living space for the given property search

building_size_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties with an interior, living square footage between a min and max.  Maximum square footage of the interior living space for the given property search

estimated_equity_min.description: Filter for properties based on the nominal value of equity owners have in their homes. Works well with "value_min"/"value_max".

foreclosure_date_min.description: Filter for properties based on a date range for when a specific Foreclosure document was recorded - use with "foreclosure": true & "notice_type"

last_sale_date_min.description: Minimum Date for the last sale transaction date

last_sale_date_max.description: Maximum Date for the last sale transaction date

last_sale_price_min.description: Filter for properties based on a Last Sale Price range.

lot_size_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties with lot sizes between a min and max.  Minimum square footage of the exterior lot  built for the given property search

lot_size_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties with lot sizes between a min and max.  Maximum square footage of the exterior lot  built for the given property search

median_income_min.description: Filter for properties that are within a certain range of median income (Zipcode-level)

mortgage_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties with an estimated total of open mortgages between a min and max.  Minimum estimated amount for all open mortgages for the given property search.

mortgage_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties with an estimated total of open mortgages between a min and max.  Maximum estimated amount for all open mortgages for the given property search.

rooms_min.description: Used for setting the minimum on the number of total rooms you want your properties to have.

rooms_max.description: Used for setting the maximum on the number of total rooms you want your properties to have.

portfolio_equity_min.description: Used to find properties where the minimum ownership interest or the stake that an investor has in the portfolio is as specified. Portfolio equity is the difference between the total value of the portfolio and any outstanding debts or liabilities related to the portfolio.

portfolio_equity_max.description: Used to find properties where the maximum ownership interest or the stake that an investor has in the portfolio is as specified. Portfolio equity is the difference between the total value of the portfolio and any outstanding debts or liabilities related to the portfolio.

portfolio_mortgage_balance_min.description: Filter for properties based on the remaining open mortgage balance of the Portfolio for Owners with > 1 property

portfolio_value_min.description: Filter for properties based on the Total Value of the Portfolio for Owners with > 1 property

pre_foreclosure_date_min.description: Filter by the Recording Date of Pre-Foreclosure Related Documents. Use with "pre_foreclosure": true

prior_owner_months_owned_min.description: Define the time range for what constitutes a "Flip" period between the last 2 transactions

properties_owned_min.description: The minimum amount of total properties that any property owner's portfolio will have for each property returned.

properties_owned_max.description: The maximum amount of total properties that any property owner's portfolio will have for each property returned.

stories_min.description: The minimum amount of floors/stories you want properties in your response to have

stories_max.description: The maximum amount of floors/stories you want properties in your response to have

tax_delinquent_year_min.description: 2019 - 2022 range yields most results. Matching Min & Max will give a single year range.

tax_delinquent_year_max.description: 2019 - 2022 range yields most results. Matching Min & Max will give a single year range.

units_min.description: The minimum amount of individual units that the property contains

units_max.description: The maximum amount of individual units that the property contains

value_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties with an estimated value between a min and max.  Minimum estimated value for the given property search

value_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties with an estimated value between a min and max.  Maximum estimated value for the given property search.

year_min.description: **Deprecation Notice** (replace with year_built_min). Used for searching a range of properties built between a min and max.  Minimum year built for the given property search

year_max.description: **Deprecation Notice** (replace with year_built_min). Used for searching a range of properties built between a min and max.  Maximum year built for the given property search

year_built_min.description: Used for searching a range of properties built between a min and max.  Minimum year built for the given property search

year_built_max.description: Used for searching a range of properties built between a min and max.  Minimum year built for the given property search

years_owned_min.description: Number value for lower bound of a range search for years_owned. Used in conjunction with years_owned_max

years_owned_max.description: Number value for lower bound of a range search for years_owned. Used in conjunction with years_owned_min.

last_update_date_min.description: fetch property IDs of properties that have been updated in a given time range.

address.example: 13723 Neil Armstrong Ave Unit 308, Herndon, Va 20171
13723 Neil Armstrong Ave Unit 308, Herndon, Va 20171

parameters.name: x-user-id
parameters.description: Denote a unique user identifier to this api call by passing it in this header field

id.description: Property ID of an object returned by our Property Search API

address.description: A fully formatted address with the following form: 123 Main St, City State Zip

code-samples.code:
curl --request POST \
     --url https://api.realestateapi.com/v2/PropertyComps \
     --header 'Accept: application/json' \
     --header 'Content-Type: application/json'
     --data `{
       "address": "123 Main St, Arlington VA 22205"
     }'

post.description:
The AutoComplete approximates like property searches based on Incomplete Address Parts and Combinations. Our AutoComplete algorithms are powered by machine learning and give you rich property lists without having to design tons of different and possibly complex Property Search queries.

The results from this API can be used in Property Search to get quick Property Lists. Use this API in application Search Bars or anywhere that your users are manually inputting addresses.

search_types.description: Filter out unwanted results by specifying your desired searchType. Options: A (full address), C (city+state), G (neighborhood name), N (county), P (APN), T (state), Z (zip)

precision.description: number of precision digits on your lat/lng (1-10)

addresses.description: Provide up to 100 addresses per request

key.description: This key will be returned in the response per address submitted to help relate the request to the response data.

address.description: Formatted address including street, city, state and zip.

street.description: Contains the house number, pre-direction, street name, street type and post-direction.

city.description: Name of the city where the address is located.

state.description: Two letter abbreviation for the state where the address is located.

zip.description: Five digit zip code where the property is located.

errorMessage.example: Zip code must be 5 digits in length.
Zip code must be 5 digits in length.

address.description: The fully formatted address for your subject property (e.g. 123 Main St, Arlington, VA 22205)

exact_match.description: Enforces strictness on the address matching. No fuzzy matching.

max_days_back.description: Specify 30 (days), 60 (days), 90 (days), etc. range for the recent sales comps that are returned.

max_results.description: Cap the amount of comps you want returned and how contribute to your AVM calculation.

same_baths.description: If true, all comps returned will have the same number of bathrooms

same_beds.description: If true, all comps returned will have the same number of bedrooms

same_census_tract.description: If true, all comps returned will reside inside the same census tract

same_county.description: If true, all comps returned will reside in the same county

same_neighborhood.description: If true, all comps returned will reside in the same neighborhood

same_zip.description: If true, all comps returned will reside in the same zipcode

bathrooms_min.description: Set a range for the number of bathrooms in the house, so that comps returned match those specs

bedrooms_min.description: Set a range for the number of bedrooms in the house, so that comps returned match those specs

living_square_feet_min.description: Set a range for the square feet of the property, so that comps returned match the size specifications

lot_square_feet_min.description: Set a range for the square feet of the lot, so that comps returned match the size specifications

year_built_min.description: Set a range for the year your comparable properties were built

post.description: Check out the functionality of this endpoint at https://www.propgpt.com

parameters.name: x-openai-key
parameters.description: Sign up with OpenAI (at https://openai.com/blog/openai-api) and get your free API Key to attach to all your requests to this endpoint for token spend tracking.

query.description: A natural language string that references data points in the Property Search API in order to retrieve a list of properties.

model.description: Options: gpt-4, gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini, gpt-4-turbo, gpt-3.5-turbo

query.example: Find all properties listed for sale in Herndon Virginia between 600K and 700K

post.description: Need the most precise Valuations for properties possible? Try out our Lender Grade AVM that uses statistical modeling, recent sales data, and market-to-market analysis to produce reliable AVMs
Go beyond our standard tax_liens & add Involuntary Lien Data to your Insights on a Property
Have your PropTech Maps Come to Life with Unlimited "Pins" on a Map API. Only available on Growth+ Plans

address.description: Only use if performing a radius search around a specific fully formatted address (123 Main St, Anywhere, TX 11111)

property_use_code.description: can also be an array of property use codes: [128, 392, etc.]
